Label: # Stop an application for probate   Use this service to stop an application for a grant of representation for up to 6 months. This is also known as 'entering a caveat'. You may want to stop an application when your client: * thinks the person who made the will was being influenced by someone else or was not able to make their own decisions  * thinks someone interfered with the will or forged it  * there is a more recent will  * the will was not properly signed and witnessed   * the person applying for probate refuses to share a copy of the will with you * your client is in dispute with the person applying or you think they are not suitable to carry out the instructions in the will * thinks the person applying is not eligible to apply if there is no will (see who inherits if there is no will) * your client is entitled to apply but have not been included in the application * the person who died got married or entered into a civil partnership after the will was signed These are the most common reasons, but there may be others too. Your client should always try to come to an agreement with the person applying for probate before you stop their application. It takes one working day for your request to stop applications in progress. If an application is approved on the same day you make the request, it will not be stopped. But you will stop any future applications for probate made on the estate for 6 months.   ## You will need: * an address in England or Wales where legal papers can be sent to you * the full name of the person who died (and any other names they were known by) * the exact date they died ## Fees It costs £3 to stop an application for 6 months. You’ll need to pay by PBA.
### What's the full name of the applicant?

### What's the full name of the deceased? 
Use the name on the death certificate
HintText: Use the name on the death certificate

Label: How do you want to pay?
Fee account number
HintText: Enter your account number without the letters PBA, for example 001234

Label: Fee account number
HintText: Select the correct PBA number from the list

Label: Customer reference
HintText: This should be your own unique reference to identify the case. It will appear on your statements.

Label: Does this organisation have any PBAs associated?

### You don't have a registered PBA ### This case will not be saved ## Register an existing PBA with MyHMCTS If you want to pay with a different PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk to ask for your PBA to be registered with your MyHMCTS account. You should include your organisation name and PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for your account to be updated. You’ll need to start your case again to pay the fee. ## Apply to get a new PBA You’ll need to provide details for you and your organisation, including the required credit limit for your account. Once your account has been registered, you’ll be able to proceed with your case and pay the applicable fee. Read more information on registering for PBA.

Pay with another PBA
If there’s 1 PBA listed
If you want to pay with a different PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk to ask for your PBA to be registered with your MyHMCTS account. You should include your organisation name and PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for your account to be updated. You’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee
If there are 2 PBAs listed
You won’t be able to add another PBA. You can only submit this case online using one of the PBAs from the menu. If you want to remove a PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk. You should include the PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for the PBA to be removed. We’ll send you confirmation. Select ‘cancel’ below to discard the case.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this application? You will no longer be able to view the details in the future.
